potential_tria6.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : potential_tria3.c                                               *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Calculates the electric potential at the required point Xin and returns its *
00009 * real and imaginary parts in array mPot.                                     *
00010 * Works for quadratic interpolation in triangular elements (6-noded triangles)*
00011 *                                                                             *
00012 * mPot[0] = Re(V)    |    mPot[1] = Im(V)                                     *
00013 ******************************************************************************/
00014

00016 * COPYRIGHT & LICENSE INFORMATION                                             *

00019 * Performance Computing (A*STAR)                                              *

00025 * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or           *
00026 * (at your option) any later version.                                         *
00027 *                                                                             *
00028 * depSolver is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,                *
00029 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of              *
00030 * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the               *
00031 * GNU General Public License for more details.                                *
00032 *                                                                             *
00033 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License           *

00035 * Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA  *

00038 #include "constants.h"
00039 #include "potential_tria6.h"
00040 
00041 int potential_tria6(double *Xin, double **mNodes, unsigned int **mElems, 
00042                     double *vB, double *mPot)
00043 {
00044     const unsigned int ELEMS = nElems, NODES_IN_ELEM = 6;
00045     unsigned int currentNode, i, j, test, SinNode; 
00046     double A, dx, dy, dz;
00047     double normal[3], SubP[6];
00048     double X[6][3];
00049 
00050     /* Initialize */
00051     A = 1.0/(pi4*eps0);
00052     mPot[0] = mPot[1] = 0.0;
00053  
00054     for(i = 0; i < ELEMS; i++){
00055         
00056         /* Coordinates of nodes of this element */
00057         for(j = 0; j < NODES_IN_ELEM; j++){
00058             currentNode = mElems[i][j] - 1;
00059             X[j][0] = mNodes[currentNode][0];
00060             X[j][1] = mNodes[currentNode][1];
00061             X[j][2] = mNodes[currentNode][2];
00062         }
00063 
00064         /* Test for singular case */
00065         test = 0;
00066         for(j = 0; j < NODES_IN_ELEM; j++){
00067             dx = X[j][0] - Xin[0];
00068             dy = X[j][1] - Xin[1];
00069             dz = X[j][2] - Xin[2];
00070             if(dx == 0 && dy == 0.0 && dz == 0.0 && test == 0){
00071                 test = 1;
00072                 SinNode = j+1;
00073                 getNormal_tria6(mElems[i][j],mNodes,mElems,normal);
00074             }
00075         }
00076 
00077         /* Contribution from all j nodes in element i */
00078         if(test == 1) intSingularG_tria6(SinNode,X,Xin,SubP);
00079         else intG_tria6(X,Xin,SubP);
00080 
00081         /* Add contribution to potential from element i */
00082         for(j = 0; j < NODES_IN_ELEM; j++){
00083             currentNode = mElems[i][j] - 1;
00084             mPot[0] += A*SubP[j]*vB[currentNode];
00085             mPot[1] += A*SubP[j]*vB[currentNode + nNodes];
00086         }
00087     }
00088 
00089     return 0;
00090 }
